info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 6:55AM CDT until June 18 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SIMPSON...EASTERN LINCOLN...LAWRENCE...SOUTHEASTERN COPIAH AND JEFFERSON DAVIS COUNTIES... At 655 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oma, or 12 miles north of Monticello, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Wanilla around 700 AM CDT. New Hebron around 705 AM CDT. Monticello around 710 AM CDT. Silver Creek around 715 AM CDT. Prentiss, Progress and Arm around 720 AM CDT. Carson and Oak Vale around 730 AM CDT. Bassfield around 735 AM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
